UVMC Connection Example - SC to SV, SV side
DescriptionThis example shows an SC producer driving an SV consumer via a TLM connection made with UVMC.
This example is derived from the UVM Connect examples, so the diagramdepicts components with TLM2 sockets.

Description

This example shows an SC producer driving an SV consumer via a TLM connection made with UVMC.  See UVMC Connection Example - SC to SV, SC side to see the SC portion of the example.

This example is derived from the UVM Connect examples, so the diagram

depicts components with TLM2 sockets.  TLM2 is not available in OVM, so this OVM components use TLM1 blocking put ports.  Whether sockets or ports/exports, the connection syntax is the same.

The sv_main top-level module below creates and starts the SV portion of this example.  It does the following:

  • Creates an instance of a consumer component
  • Registers the consumer’s in target socket with UVMC using the arbitrary string, “42”.  During elaboration, UVMC will connect this port with a port registered with the same lookup string.  In this example, the match will occur with a producer’s in port on the SC side.
  • Calls run_test to start UVM simulation

TLM connections would normally be made in the connect callback of a UVM component.  This example does not show that for sake of highlighting the UVMC connect functionality.

.../examples_ovm/connections/sc2sv.sv


import ovm_pkg::*; 
import ovmc_pkg::*;

`include "consumer.sv"

module sv_main;

  consumer cons = new("cons");

  initial begin
    uvmc_tlm1 #(packet)::connect(cons.in, "42");
    uvmc_init();
    run_test();
  end

endmodule
This example shows a SC producer driving a SV consumer via a TLM connection made with UVMC, including how to derive a SC producer subtype that can control UVM phasing using the UVMC Command API.
